intro: Allocarya scalpocarpa, commonly known as the scarlet root or scarlet lily, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces a fibrous root system that is often harvested for its medicinal properties. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are typically erect and slender. Allocarya scalpocarpa thrives in well-drained soils and requires a cool, temperate climate for optimal growth.
